messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Karma was:Bishop Thomas O'Brien
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/19/03 7:45:50 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Ahhhh, Mary, Karma is a wonderful thing. Also known as Universal Law, for every action there
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/19/03 7:45:50 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
mummy124@... writes:

> This kind of made me chuckle. Not in a "see what happened" way but I just
> never would have looked at it like that. I'm not really up on karma but I
> get the idea.
>
> Thanks for the view.
>
> Mary B
>

Ahhhh, Mary, Karma is a wonderful thing. Also known as Universal Law, for
every action there is an equal and/or opposite reaction or in simpler terms,
whatever one puts out, one receives back. In very simple terms: Be kind, receive
kindness, share knowledge, receive knowledge, be cruel & expect cruelty. So,
although it is based in the Laws of the Universe, the choice is yours as to what
you send out and what you will automatically be returned based on that
initial choice. The only problem being that not all actions and subsequent reactions
necessarily occur within the same lifetime.

If you want to know more, just ask. Just remember, there are many points of
view.

Rhonda


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
